properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 8 at 7:14AM MST until February 8 at 7:45AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
East central Gallatin County in south central Montana...

* Until 745 AM MST.

* At 714 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Bozeman,
moving southeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph.

SOURCE...Public reported visibility of less than 100 feet in heavy
snow.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

*

This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 307 and 321.

Locations impacted include...
Bozeman and Bozeman Pass.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are
expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden
whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 7:45 AM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
